subject: Education
subcategory: Literacy and the Power of Reading
title: Malala Yousafzai: Shot for Reading
description: One-minute skill: Malala Yousafzai: Shot for Reading.

hook.text: In 2012, a Taliban gunman shot 15-year-old Malala Yousafzai in the head for the crime of going to school and learning

buildup.text: The Taliban had banned girls' education in Pakistan's Swat Valley. Malala blogged for the BBC about her right to attend

discovery.text: Malala survived the shooting, recovered, and became the youngest Nobel Peace Prize winner in history ‚Äî at age 17.

twist.text: The Taliban shot her to silence one girl. Instead, they created a global icon for girls' education. Fear created

climax.text: Malala's story proves that education for girls is so powerful that armed men tried to kill a child to stop it.

punchline.text: They shot her for reading. She won the Nobel Prize for not stopping.

quiz.question: Why was Malala Yousafzai targeted by the Taliban?
options: For advocating girls' right to education
